channel.title: Graphics Card transplant?
channel.description: Okay, so I have this old computer (piece of shit) but it has a NVIDIA 6200 A-LE. Now it's much better than my Intel media accelerator. Now; is there any possible place that could swap my cards? And if so, what would be the price?

item.title: Graphics Card transplant?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:11, topic:300869”][quote author=chrisn2323 link=topic=397156.msg2949839#msg2949839 date=1252438514]
make sure when u put in ur new card, u tell the bios to use the dedicated card, not the integrated one.
[/quote]
this. I had priblems for ages because of this once[/quote]

Same, was so gay I couldn’t hear any sound.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card transplant?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

He can’t swap them, but he can put the card into his newer pc.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card transplant?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

chrisn2323:

make sure when u put in ur new card, u tell the bios to use the dedicated card, not the integrated one.

this. I had priblems for ages because of this once

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card transplant?
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

make sure when u put in ur new card, u tell the bios to use the dedicated card, not the integrated one.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card transplant?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I just meant that if either are onboard he can’t swap them like he wants. If the 6200 isn’t onboard it could still potentially be taken out and put in another computer. It wouldn’t be pcie though, instead either PCI or AGP.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card transplant?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:300869”]Are either one of them onboard graphics cards? If so then no, you can’t change them at all. If both of them are not onboard, then just pull them out and swap.

(but I’ve never seen an Intel card that was not onboard, has anyone else?)[/quote]
most mobos with onboard graphics cards also have pcie or whatever slot

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card transplant?
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:300869”]Are either one of them onboard graphics cards? If so then no, you can’t change them at all. If both of them are not onboard, then just pull them out and swap.

(but I’ve never seen an Intel card that was not onboard, has anyone else?)[/quote]
But you shouldn’t need to pull it out if it’s fixed? I didn’t when I built my new PC.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card transplant?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Are either one of them onboard graphics cards? If so then no, you can’t change them at all. If both of them are not onboard, then just pull them out and swap.

(but I’ve never seen an Intel card that was not onboard, has anyone else?)

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card transplant?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

In that case, I’ve PMed you my address and paypal, I charge $75/hour plus shipping and should have it done in 6-10 hours.
